31#include <sys/cdefs.h>
32__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: drm_atomic.c,v 1.7 2018/08/27 07:45:55 riastradh Exp $");
33
34#include <linux/export.h>
35
36#include <drm/drmP.h>
37#include <drm/drm_atomic.h>
38#include <drm/drm_crtc_internal.h>
39#include <drm/drm_plane_helper.h>
40
41/**
42 * drm_atomic_state_default_release -
43 * release memory initialized by drm_atomic_state_init
44 * @state: atomic state
45 *
46 * Free all the memory allocated by drm_atomic_state_init.
47 * This is useful for drivers that subclass the atomic state.
48 */
49void drm_atomic_state_default_release(struct drm_atomic_state *state)
50{
51 kfree(state->connectors);
52 kfree(state->connector_states);
53 kfree(state->crtcs);
54 kfree(state->crtc_states);
55 kfree(state->planes);
56 kfree(state->plane_states);
57}
58EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_atomic_state_default_release);
59
60/**
61 * drm_atomic_state_init - init new atomic state
62 * @dev: DRM device
63 * @state: atomic state
64 *
65 * Default implementation for filling in a new atomic state.
66 * This is useful for drivers that subclass the atomic state.
67 */
68int
69drm_atomic_state_init(struct drm_device *dev, struct drm_atomic_state *state)
70{
71 /* TODO legacy paths should maybe do a better job about
72 * setting this appropriately?
73 */
74 state->allow_modeset = true;
75
76 state->num_connector = ACCESS_ONCE(dev->mode_config.num_connector);
77
78 state->crtcs = kcalloc(dev->mode_config.num_crtc,
79 sizeof(*state->crtcs), GFP_KERNEL);
80 if (!state->crtcs)
81 goto fail;
82 state->crtc_states = kcalloc(dev->mode_config.num_crtc,
83 sizeof(*state->crtc_states), GFP_KERNEL);
84 if (!state->crtc_states)
85 goto fail;
86 state->planes = kcalloc(dev->mode_config.num_total_plane,
87 sizeof(*state->planes), GFP_KERNEL);
88 if (!state->planes)
89 goto fail;
90 state->plane_states = kcalloc(dev->mode_config.num_total_plane,
91 sizeof(*state->plane_states), GFP_KERNEL);
92 if (!state->plane_states)
93 goto fail;
94 state->connectors = kcalloc(state->num_connector,
95 sizeof(*state->connectors),
96 GFP_KERNEL);
97 if (!state->connectors)
98 goto fail;
99 state->connector_states = kcalloc(state->num_connector,
100 sizeof(*state->connector_states),
101 GFP_KERNEL);
102 if (!state->connector_states)
103 goto fail;
104
105 state->dev = dev;
106
107 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("Allocated atomic state %p\n", state);
108
109 return 0;
110fail:
111 drm_atomic_state_default_release(state);
112 return -ENOMEM;
113}
114EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_atomic_state_init);
115
116/**
117 * drm_atomic_state_alloc - allocate atomic state
118 * @dev: DRM device
119 *
120 * This allocates an empty atomic state to track updates.
121 */
122struct drm_atomic_state *
123drm_atomic_state_alloc(struct drm_device *dev)
124{
125 struct drm_mode_config *config = &dev->mode_config;
126 struct drm_atomic_state *state;
127
128 if (!config->funcs->atomic_state_alloc) {
129 state = kzalloc(sizeof(*state), GFP_KERNEL);
130 if (!state)
131 return NULL;
132 if (drm_atomic_state_init(dev, state) < 0) {
133 kfree(state);
134 return NULL;
135 }
136 return state;
137 }
138
139 return config->funcs->atomic_state_alloc(dev);
140}
141EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_atomic_state_alloc);
142
143/**
144 * drm_atomic_state_default_clear - clear base atomic state
145 * @state: atomic state
146 *
147 * Default implementation for clearing atomic state.
148 * This is useful for drivers that subclass the atomic state.
149 */
150void drm_atomic_state_default_clear(struct drm_atomic_state *state)
151{
152 struct drm_device *dev = state->dev;
153 struct drm_mode_config *config = &dev->mode_config;
154 int i;
155
156 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("Clearing atomic state %p\n", state);
157
158 for (i = 0; i < state->num_connector; i++) {
159 struct drm_connector *connector = state->connectors[i];
160
161 if (!connector || !connector->funcs)
162 continue;
163
164 /*
165 * FIXME: Async commits can race with connector unplugging and
166 * there's currently nothing that prevents cleanup up state for
167 * deleted connectors. As long as the callback doesn't look at
168 * the connector we'll be fine though, so make sure that's the
169 * case by setting all connector pointers to NULL.
170 */
171 state->connector_states[i]->connector = NULL;
172 connector->funcs->atomic_destroy_state(NULL,
173 state->connector_states[i]);
174 state->connectors[i] = NULL;
175 state->connector_states[i] = NULL;
176 }
177
178 for (i = 0; i < config->num_crtc; i++) {
179 struct drm_crtc *crtc = state->crtcs[i];
180
181 if (!crtc)
182 continue;
183
184 crtc->funcs->atomic_destroy_state(crtc,
185 state->crtc_states[i]);
186 state->crtcs[i] = NULL;
187 state->crtc_states[i] = NULL;
188 }
189
190 for (i = 0; i < config->num_total_plane; i++) {
191 struct drm_plane *plane = state->planes[i];
192
193 if (!plane)
194 continue;
195
196 plane->funcs->atomic_destroy_state(plane,
197 state->plane_states[i]);
198 state->planes[i] = NULL;
199 state->plane_states[i] = NULL;
200 }
201}
202EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_atomic_state_default_clear);
203
204/**
205 * drm_atomic_state_clear - clear state object
206 * @state: atomic state
207 *
208 * When the w/w mutex algorithm detects a deadlock we need to back off and drop
209 * all locks. So someone else could sneak in and change the current modeset
210 * configuration. Which means that all the state assembled in @state is no
211 * longer an atomic update to the current state, but to some arbitrary earlier
212 * state. Which could break assumptions the driver's ->atomic_check likely
213 * relies on.
214 *
215 * Hence we must clear all cached state and completely start over, using this
216 * function.
217 */
218void drm_atomic_state_clear(struct drm_atomic_state *state)
219{
220 struct drm_device *dev = state->dev;
221 struct drm_mode_config *config = &dev->mode_config;
222
223 if (config->funcs->atomic_state_clear)
224 config->funcs->atomic_state_clear(state);
225 else
226 drm_atomic_state_default_clear(state);
227}
228EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_atomic_state_clear);
229
230/**
231 * drm_atomic_state_free - free all memory for an atomic state
232 * @state: atomic state to deallocate
233 *
234 * This frees all memory associated with an atomic state, including all the
235 * per-object state for planes, crtcs and connectors.
236 */
237void drm_atomic_state_free(struct drm_atomic_state *state)
238{
239 struct drm_device *dev;
240 struct drm_mode_config *config;
241
242 if (!state)
243 return;
244
245 dev = state->dev;
246 config = &dev->mode_config;
247
248 drm_atomic_state_clear(state);
249
250 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("Freeing atomic state %p\n", state);
251
252 if (config->funcs->atomic_state_free) {
253 config->funcs->atomic_state_free(state);
254 } else {
255 drm_atomic_state_default_release(state);
256 kfree(state);
257 }
258}
259EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_atomic_state_free);
260
261/**
262 * drm_atomic_get_crtc_state - get crtc state
263 * @state: global atomic state object
264 * @crtc: crtc to get state object for
265 *
266 * This function returns the crtc state for the given crtc, allocating it if
267 * needed. It will also grab the relevant crtc lock to make sure that the state
268 * is consistent.
269 *
270 * Returns:
271 *
272 * Either the allocated state or the error code encoded into the pointer. When
273 * the error is EDEADLK then the w/w mutex code has detected a deadlock and the
274 * entire atomic sequence must be restarted. All other errors are fatal.
275 */
276struct drm_crtc_state *
277drm_atomic_get_crtc_state(struct drm_atomic_state *state,
278 struct drm_crtc *crtc)
279{
280 int ret, index = drm_crtc_index(crtc);
281 struct drm_crtc_state *crtc_state;
282
283 crtc_state = drm_atomic_get_existing_crtc_state(state, crtc);
284 if (crtc_state)
285 return crtc_state;
286
287 ret = drm_modeset_lock(&crtc->mutex, state->acquire_ctx);
288 if (ret)
289 return ERR_PTR(ret);
290
291 crtc_state = crtc->funcs->atomic_duplicate_state(crtc);
292 if (!crtc_state)
293 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
294
295 state->crtc_states[index] = crtc_state;
296 state->crtcs[index] = crtc;
297 crtc_state->state = state;
298
299 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("Added [CRTC:%d] %p state to %p\n",
300 crtc->base.id, crtc_state, state);
301
302 return crtc_state;
303}
304EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_atomic_get_crtc_state);
305
306/**
307 * drm_atomic_set_mode_for_crtc - set mode for CRTC
308 * @state: the CRTC whose incoming state to update
309 * @mode: kernel-internal mode to use for the CRTC, or NULL to disable
310 *
311 * Set a mode (originating from the kernel) on the desired CRTC state. Does
312 * not change any other state properties, including enable, active, or
313 * mode_changed.
314 *
315 * RETURNS:
316 * Zero on success, error code on failure. Cannot return -EDEADLK.
317 */
318int drm_atomic_set_mode_for_crtc(struct drm_crtc_state *state,
319 struct drm_display_mode *mode)
320{
321 struct drm_mode_modeinfo umode;
322
323 /* Early return for no change. */
324 if (mode && memcmp(&state->mode, mode, sizeof(*mode)) == 0)
325 return 0;
326
327 if (state->mode_blob)
328 drm_property_unreference_blob(state->mode_blob);
329 state->mode_blob = NULL;
330
331 if (mode) {
332 drm_mode_convert_to_umode(&umode, mode);
333 state->mode_blob =
334 drm_property_create_blob(state->crtc->dev,
335 sizeof(umode),
336 &umode);
337 if (IS_ERR(state->mode_blob))
338 return PTR_ERR(state->mode_blob);
339
340 drm_mode_copy(&state->mode, mode);
341 state->enable = true;
342 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("Set [MODE:%s] for CRTC state %p\n",
343 mode->name, state);
344 } else {
345 memset(&state->mode, 0, sizeof(state->mode));
346 state->enable = false;
347 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("Set [NOMODE] for CRTC state %p\n",
348 state);
349 }
350
351 return 0;
352}
353EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_atomic_set_mode_for_crtc);
354
355/**
356 * drm_atomic_set_mode_prop_for_crtc - set mode for CRTC
357 * @state: the CRTC whose incoming state to update
358 * @blob: pointer to blob property to use for mode
359 *
360 * Set a mode (originating from a blob property) on the desired CRTC state.
361 * This function will take a reference on the blob property for the CRTC state,
362 * and release the reference held on the state's existing mode property, if any
363 * was set.
364 *
365 * RETURNS:
366 * Zero on success, error code on failure. Cannot return -EDEADLK.
367 */
368int drm_atomic_set_mode_prop_for_crtc(struct drm_crtc_state *state,
369 struct drm_property_blob *blob)
370{
371 if (blob == state->mode_blob)
372 return 0;
373
374 if (state->mode_blob)
375 drm_property_unreference_blob(state->mode_blob);
376 state->mode_blob = NULL;
377
378 memset(&state->mode, 0, sizeof(state->mode));
379
380 if (blob) {
381 if (blob->length != sizeof(struct drm_mode_modeinfo) ||
382 drm_mode_convert_umode(&state->mode,
383 (const struct drm_mode_modeinfo *)
384 blob->data))
385 return -EINVAL;
386
387 state->mode_blob = drm_property_reference_blob(blob);
388 state->enable = true;
389 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("Set [MODE:%s] for CRTC state %p\n",
390 state->mode.name, state);
391 } else {
392 state->enable = false;
393 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("Set [NOMODE] for CRTC state %p\n",
394 state);
395 }
396
397 return 0;
398}
399EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_atomic_set_mode_prop_for_crtc);
400
401/**
402 * drm_atomic_crtc_set_property - set property on CRTC
403 * @crtc: the drm CRTC to set a property on
404 * @state: the state object to update with the new property value
405 * @property: the property to set
406 * @val: the new property value
407 *
408 * Use this instead of calling crtc->atomic_set_property directly.
409 * This function handles generic/core properties and calls out to
410 * driver's ->atomic_set_property() for driver properties. To ensure
411 * consistent behavior you must call this function rather than the
412 * driver hook directly.
413 *
414 * RETURNS:
415 * Zero on success, error code on failure
416 */
417int drm_atomic_crtc_set_property(struct drm_crtc *crtc,
418 struct drm_crtc_state *state, struct drm_property *property,
419 uint64_t val)
420{
421 struct drm_device *dev = crtc->dev;
422 struct drm_mode_config *config = &dev->mode_config;
423 int ret;
424
425 if (property == config->prop_active)
426 state->active = val;
427 else if (property == config->prop_mode_id) {
428 struct drm_property_blob *mode =
429 drm_property_lookup_blob(dev, val);
430 ret = drm_atomic_set_mode_prop_for_crtc(state, mode);
431 if (mode)
432 drm_property_unreference_blob(mode);
433 return ret;
434 }
435 else if (crtc->funcs->atomic_set_property)
436 return crtc->funcs->atomic_set_property(crtc, state, property, val);
437 else
438 return -EINVAL;
439
440 return 0;
441}
442EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_atomic_crtc_set_property);
443
444/*
445 * This function handles generic/core properties and calls out to
446 * driver's ->atomic_get_property() for driver properties. To ensure
447 * consistent behavior you must call this function rather than the
448 * driver hook directly.
449 */
450static int
451drm_atomic_crtc_get_property(struct drm_crtc *crtc,
452 const struct drm_crtc_state *state,
453 struct drm_property *property, uint64_t *val)
454{
455 struct drm_device *dev = crtc->dev;
456 struct drm_mode_config *config = &dev->mode_config;
457
458 if (property == config->prop_active)
459 *val = state->active;
460 else if (property == config->prop_mode_id)
461 *val = (state->mode_blob) ? state->mode_blob->base.id : 0;
462 else if (crtc->funcs->atomic_get_property)
463 return crtc->funcs->atomic_get_property(crtc, state, property, val);
464 else
465 return -EINVAL;
466
467 return 0;
468}
469
470/**
471 * drm_atomic_crtc_check - check crtc state
472 * @crtc: crtc to check
473 * @state: crtc state to check
474 *
475 * Provides core sanity checks for crtc state.
476 *
477 * RETURNS:
478 * Zero on success, error code on failure
479 */
480static int drm_atomic_crtc_check(struct drm_crtc *crtc,
481 struct drm_crtc_state *state)
482{
483 /* NOTE: we explicitly don't enforce constraints such as primary
484 * layer covering entire screen, since that is something we want
485 * to allow (on hw that supports it). For hw that does not, it
486 * should be checked in driver's crtc->atomic_check() vfunc.
487 *
488 * TODO: Add generic modeset state checks once we support those.
489 */
490
491 if (state->active && !state->enable) {
492 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("[CRTC:%d] active without enabled\n",
493 crtc->base.id);
494 return -EINVAL;
495 }
496
497 /* The state->enable vs. state->mode_blob checks can be WARN_ON,
498 * as this is a kernel-internal detail that userspace should never
499 * be able to trigger. */
500 if (drm_core_check_feature(crtc->dev, DRIVER_ATOMIC) &&
501 WARN_ON(state->enable && !state->mode_blob)) {
502 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("[CRTC:%d] enabled without mode blob\n",
503 crtc->base.id);
504 return -EINVAL;
505 }
506
507 if (drm_core_check_feature(crtc->dev, DRIVER_ATOMIC) &&
508 WARN_ON(!state->enable && state->mode_blob)) {
509 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("[CRTC:%d] disabled with mode blob\n",
510 crtc->base.id);
511 return -EINVAL;
512 }
513
514 return 0;
515}
516
517/**
518 * drm_atomic_get_plane_state - get plane state
519 * @state: global atomic state object
520 * @plane: plane to get state object for
521 *
522 * This function returns the plane state for the given plane, allocating it if
523 * needed. It will also grab the relevant plane lock to make sure that the state
524 * is consistent.
525 *
526 * Returns:
527 *
528 * Either the allocated state or the error code encoded into the pointer. When
529 * the error is EDEADLK then the w/w mutex code has detected a deadlock and the
530 * entire atomic sequence must be restarted. All other errors are fatal.
531 */
532struct drm_plane_state *
533drm_atomic_get_plane_state(struct drm_atomic_state *state,
534 struct drm_plane *plane)
535{
536 int ret, index = drm_plane_index(plane);
537 struct drm_plane_state *plane_state;
538
539 plane_state = drm_atomic_get_existing_plane_state(state, plane);
540 if (plane_state)
541 return plane_state;
542
543 ret = drm_modeset_lock(&plane->mutex, state->acquire_ctx);
544 if (ret)
545 return ERR_PTR(ret);
546
547 plane_state = plane->funcs->atomic_duplicate_state(plane);
548 if (!plane_state)
549 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
550
551 state->plane_states[index] = plane_state;
552 state->planes[index] = plane;
553 plane_state->state = state;
554
555 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("Added [PLANE:%d] %p state to %p\n",
556 plane->base.id, plane_state, state);
557
558 if (plane_state->crtc) {
559 struct drm_crtc_state *crtc_state;
560
561 crtc_state = drm_atomic_get_crtc_state(state,
562 plane_state->crtc);
563 if (IS_ERR(crtc_state))
564 return ERR_CAST(crtc_state);
565 }
566
567 return plane_state;
568}
569EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_atomic_get_plane_state);
570
571/**
572 * drm_atomic_plane_set_property - set property on plane
573 * @plane: the drm plane to set a property on
574 * @state: the state object to update with the new property value
575 * @property: the property to set
576 * @val: the new property value
577 *
578 * Use this instead of calling plane->atomic_set_property directly.
579 * This function handles generic/core properties and calls out to
580 * driver's ->atomic_set_property() for driver properties. To ensure
581 * consistent behavior you must call this function rather than the
582 * driver hook directly.
583 *
584 * RETURNS:
585 * Zero on success, error code on failure
586 */
587int drm_atomic_plane_set_property(struct drm_plane *plane,
588 struct drm_plane_state *state, struct drm_property *property,
589 uint64_t val)
590{
591 struct drm_device *dev = plane->dev;
592 struct drm_mode_config *config = &dev->mode_config;
593
594 if (property == config->prop_fb_id) {
595 struct drm_framebuffer *fb = drm_framebuffer_lookup(dev, val);
596 drm_atomic_set_fb_for_plane(state, fb);
597 if (fb)
598 drm_framebuffer_unreference(fb);
599 } else if (property == config->prop_crtc_id) {
600 struct drm_crtc *crtc = drm_crtc_find(dev, val);
601 return drm_atomic_set_crtc_for_plane(state, crtc);
602 } else if (property == config->prop_crtc_x) {
603 state->crtc_x = U642I64(val);
604 } else if (property == config->prop_crtc_y) {
605 state->crtc_y = U642I64(val);
606 } else if (property == config->prop_crtc_w) {
607 state->crtc_w = val;
608 } else if (property == config->prop_crtc_h) {
609 state->crtc_h = val;
610 } else if (property == config->prop_src_x) {
611 state->src_x = val;
612 } else if (property == config->prop_src_y) {
613 state->src_y = val;
614 } else if (property == config->prop_src_w) {
615 state->src_w = val;
616 } else if (property == config->prop_src_h) {
617 state->src_h = val;
618 } else if (property == config->rotation_property) {
619 state->rotation = val;
620 } else if (plane->funcs->atomic_set_property) {
621 return plane->funcs->atomic_set_property(plane, state,
622 property, val);
623 } else {
624 return -EINVAL;
625 }
626
627 return 0;
628}
629EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_atomic_plane_set_property);
630
631/*
632 * This function handles generic/core properties and calls out to
633 * driver's ->atomic_get_property() for driver properties. To ensure
634 * consistent behavior you must call this function rather than the
635 * driver hook directly.
636 */
637static int
638drm_atomic_plane_get_property(struct drm_plane *plane,
639 const struct drm_plane_state *state,
640 struct drm_property *property, uint64_t *val)
641{
642 struct drm_device *dev = plane->dev;
643 struct drm_mode_config *config = &dev->mode_config;
644
645 if (property == config->prop_fb_id) {
646 *val = (state->fb) ? state->fb->base.id : 0;
647 } else if (property == config->prop_crtc_id) {
648 *val = (state->crtc) ? state->crtc->base.id : 0;
649 } else if (property == config->prop_crtc_x) {
650 *val = I642U64(state->crtc_x);
651 } else if (property == config->prop_crtc_y) {
652 *val = I642U64(state->crtc_y);
653 } else if (property == config->prop_crtc_w) {
654 *val = state->crtc_w;
655 } else if (property == config->prop_crtc_h) {
656 *val = state->crtc_h;
657 } else if (property == config->prop_src_x) {
658 *val = state->src_x;
659 } else if (property == config->prop_src_y) {
660 *val = state->src_y;
661 } else if (property == config->prop_src_w) {
662 *val = state->src_w;
663 } else if (property == config->prop_src_h) {
664 *val = state->src_h;
665 } else if (property == config->rotation_property) {
666 *val = state->rotation;
667 } else if (plane->funcs->atomic_get_property) {
668 return plane->funcs->atomic_get_property(plane, state, property, val);
669 } else {
670 return -EINVAL;
671 }
672
673 return 0;
674}
675
676static bool
677plane_switching_crtc(struct drm_atomic_state *state,
678 struct drm_plane *plane,
679 struct drm_plane_state *plane_state)
680{
681 if (!plane->state->crtc || !plane_state->crtc)
682 return false;
683
684 if (plane->state->crtc == plane_state->crtc)
685 return false;
686
687 /* This could be refined, but currently there's no helper or driver code
688 * to implement direct switching of active planes nor userspace to take
689 * advantage of more direct plane switching without the intermediate
690 * full OFF state.
691 */
692 return true;
693}
694
695/**
696 * drm_atomic_plane_check - check plane state
697 * @plane: plane to check
698 * @state: plane state to check
699 *
700 * Provides core sanity checks for plane state.
701 *
702 * RETURNS:
703 * Zero on success, error code on failure
704 */
705static int drm_atomic_plane_check(struct drm_plane *plane,
706 struct drm_plane_state *state)
707{
708 unsigned int fb_width, fb_height;
709 int ret;
710
711 /* either *both* CRTC and FB must be set, or neither */
712 if (WARN_ON(state->crtc && !state->fb)) {
713 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("CRTC set but no FB\n");
714 return -EINVAL;
715 } else if (WARN_ON(state->fb && !state->crtc)) {
716 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("FB set but no CRTC\n");
717 return -EINVAL;
718 }
719
720 /* if disabled, we don't care about the rest of the state: */
721 if (!state->crtc)
722 return 0;
723
724 /* Check whether this plane is usable on this CRTC */
725 if (!(plane->possible_crtcs & drm_crtc_mask(state->crtc))) {
726 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("Invalid crtc for plane\n");
727 return -EINVAL;
728 }
729
730 /* Check whether this plane supports the fb pixel format. */
731 ret = drm_plane_check_pixel_format(plane, state->fb->pixel_format);
732 if (ret) {
733 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("Invalid pixel format %s\n",
734 drm_get_format_name(state->fb->pixel_format));
735 return ret;
736 }
737
738 /* Give drivers some help against integer overflows */
739 if (state->crtc_w > INT_MAX ||
740 state->crtc_x > INT_MAX - (int32_t) state->crtc_w ||
741 state->crtc_h > INT_MAX ||
742 state->crtc_y > INT_MAX - (int32_t) state->crtc_h) {
743 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("Invalid CRTC coordinates %ux%u+%d+%d\n",
744 state->crtc_w, state->crtc_h,
745 state->crtc_x, state->crtc_y);
746 return -ERANGE;
747 }
748
749 fb_width = state->fb->width << 16;
750 fb_height = state->fb->height << 16;
751
752 /* Make sure source coordinates are inside the fb. */
753 if (state->src_w > fb_width ||
754 state->src_x > fb_width - state->src_w ||
755 state->src_h > fb_height ||
756 state->src_y > fb_height - state->src_h) {
757 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("Invalid source coordinates "
758 "%u.%06ux%u.%06u+%u.%06u+%u.%06u\n",
759 state->src_w >> 16, ((state->src_w & 0xffff) * 15625) >> 10,
760 state->src_h >> 16, ((state->src_h & 0xffff) * 15625) >> 10,
761 state->src_x >> 16, ((state->src_x & 0xffff) * 15625) >> 10,
762 state->src_y >> 16, ((state->src_y & 0xffff) * 15625) >> 10);
763 return -ENOSPC;
764 }
765
766 if (plane_switching_crtc(state->state, plane, state)) {
767 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("[PLANE:%d] switching CRTC directly\n",
768 plane->base.id);
769 return -EINVAL;
770 }
771
772 return 0;
773}
774
775/**
776 * drm_atomic_get_connector_state - get connector state
777 * @state: global atomic state object
778 * @connector: connector to get state object for
779 *
780 * This function returns the connector state for the given connector,
781 * allocating it if needed. It will also grab the relevant connector lock to
782 * make sure that the state is consistent.
783 *
784 * Returns:
785 *
786 * Either the allocated state or the error code encoded into the pointer. When
787 * the error is EDEADLK then the w/w mutex code has detected a deadlock and the
788 * entire atomic sequence must be restarted. All other errors are fatal.
789 */
790struct drm_connector_state *
791drm_atomic_get_connector_state(struct drm_atomic_state *state,
792 struct drm_connector *connector)
793{
794 int ret, index;
795 struct drm_mode_config *config = &connector->dev->mode_config;
796 struct drm_connector_state *connector_state;
797
798 ret = drm_modeset_lock(&config->connection_mutex, state->acquire_ctx);
799 if (ret)
800 return ERR_PTR(ret);
801
802 index = drm_connector_index(connector);
803
804 /*
805 * Construction of atomic state updates can race with a connector
806 * hot-add which might overflow. In this case flip the table and just
807 * restart the entire ioctl - no one is fast enough to livelock a cpu
808 * with physical hotplug events anyway.
809 *
810 * Note that we only grab the indexes once we have the right lock to
811 * prevent hotplug/unplugging of connectors. So removal is no problem,
812 * at most the array is a bit too large.
813 */
814 if (index >= state->num_connector) {
815 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("Hot-added connector would overflow state array, restarting\n");
816 return ERR_PTR(-EAGAIN);
817 }
818
819 if (state->connector_states[index])
820 return state->connector_states[index];
821
822 connector_state = connector->funcs->atomic_duplicate_state(connector);
823 if (!connector_state)
824 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
825
826 state->connector_states[index] = connector_state;
827 state->connectors[index] = connector;
828 connector_state->state = state;
829
830 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("Added [CONNECTOR:%d] %p state to %p\n",
831 connector->base.id, connector_state, state);
832
833 if (connector_state->crtc) {
834 struct drm_crtc_state *crtc_state;
835
836 crtc_state = drm_atomic_get_crtc_state(state,
837 connector_state->crtc);
838 if (IS_ERR(crtc_state))
839 return ERR_CAST(crtc_state);
840 }
841
842 return connector_state;
843}
844EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_atomic_get_connector_state);
845
846/**
847 * drm_atomic_connector_set_property - set property on connector.
848 * @connector: the drm connector to set a property on
849 * @state: the state object to update with the new property value
850 * @property: the property to set
851 * @val: the new property value
852 *
853 * Use this instead of calling connector->atomic_set_property directly.
854 * This function handles generic/core properties and calls out to
855 * driver's ->atomic_set_property() for driver properties. To ensure
856 * consistent behavior you must call this function rather than the
857 * driver hook directly.
858 *
859 * RETURNS:
860 * Zero on success, error code on failure
861 */
862int drm_atomic_connector_set_property(struct drm_connector *connector,
863 struct drm_connector_state *state, struct drm_property *property,
864 uint64_t val)
865{
866 struct drm_device *dev = connector->dev;
867 struct drm_mode_config *config = &dev->mode_config;
868
869 if (property == config->prop_crtc_id) {
870 struct drm_crtc *crtc = drm_crtc_find(dev, val);
871 return drm_atomic_set_crtc_for_connector(state, crtc);
872 } else if (property == config->dpms_property) {
873 /* setting DPMS property requires special handling, which
874 * is done in legacy setprop path for us. Disallow (for
875 * now?) atomic writes to DPMS property:
876 */
877 return -EINVAL;
878 } else if (connector->funcs->atomic_set_property) {
879 return connector->funcs->atomic_set_property(connector,
880 state, property, val);
881 } else {
882 return -EINVAL;
883 }
884}
885EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_atomic_connector_set_property);
886
887/*
888 * This function handles generic/core properties and calls out to
889 * driver's ->atomic_get_property() for driver properties. To ensure
890 * consistent behavior you must call this function rather than the
891 * driver hook directly.
892 */
893static int
894drm_atomic_connector_get_property(struct drm_connector *connector,
895 const struct drm_connector_state *state,
896 struct drm_property *property, uint64_t *val)
897{
898 struct drm_device *dev = connector->dev;
899 struct drm_mode_config *config = &dev->mode_config;
900
901 if (property == config->prop_crtc_id) {
902 *val = (state->crtc) ? state->crtc->base.id : 0;
903 } else if (property == config->dpms_property) {
904 *val = connector->dpms;
905 } else if (connector->funcs->atomic_get_property) {
906 return connector->funcs->atomic_get_property(connector,
907 state, property, val);
908 } else {
909 return -EINVAL;
910 }
911
912 return 0;
913}
914
915int drm_atomic_get_property(struct drm_mode_object *obj,
916 struct drm_property *property, uint64_t *val)
917{
918 struct drm_device *dev = property->dev;
919 int ret;
920
921 switch (obj->type) {
922 case DRM_MODE_OBJECT_CONNECTOR: {
923 struct drm_connector *connector = obj_to_connector(obj);
924 WARN_ON(!drm_modeset_is_locked(&dev->mode_config.connection_mutex));
925 ret = drm_atomic_connector_get_property(connector,
926 connector->state, property, val);
927 break;
928 }
929 case DRM_MODE_OBJECT_CRTC: {
930 struct drm_crtc *crtc = obj_to_crtc(obj);
931 WARN_ON(!drm_modeset_is_locked(&crtc->mutex));
932 ret = drm_atomic_crtc_get_property(crtc,
933 crtc->state, property, val);
934 break;
935 }
936 case DRM_MODE_OBJECT_PLANE: {
937 struct drm_plane *plane = obj_to_plane(obj);
938 WARN_ON(!drm_modeset_is_locked(&plane->mutex));
939 ret = drm_atomic_plane_get_property(plane,
940 plane->state, property, val);
941 break;
942 }
943 default:
944 ret = -EINVAL;
945 break;
946 }
947
948 return ret;
949}
950
951/**
952 * drm_atomic_set_crtc_for_plane - set crtc for plane
953 * @plane_state: the plane whose incoming state to update
954 * @crtc: crtc to use for the plane
955 *
956 * Changing the assigned crtc for a plane requires us to grab the lock and state
957 * for the new crtc, as needed. This function takes care of all these details
958 * besides updating the pointer in the state object itself.
959 *
960 * Returns:
961 * 0 on success or can fail with -EDEADLK or -ENOMEM. When the error is EDEADLK
962 * then the w/w mutex code has detected a deadlock and the entire atomic
963 * sequence must be restarted. All other errors are fatal.
964 */
965int
966drm_atomic_set_crtc_for_plane(struct drm_plane_state *plane_state,
967 struct drm_crtc *crtc)
968{
969 struct drm_plane *plane = plane_state->plane;
970 struct drm_crtc_state *crtc_state;
971
972 if (plane_state->crtc) {
973 crtc_state = drm_atomic_get_crtc_state(plane_state->state,
974 plane_state->crtc);
975 if (WARN_ON(IS_ERR(crtc_state)))
976 return PTR_ERR(crtc_state);
977
978 crtc_state->plane_mask &= ~(1 << drm_plane_index(plane));
979 }
980
981 plane_state->crtc = crtc;
982
983 if (crtc) {
984 crtc_state = drm_atomic_get_crtc_state(plane_state->state,
985 crtc);
986 if (IS_ERR(crtc_state))
987 return PTR_ERR(crtc_state);
988 crtc_state->plane_mask |= (1 << drm_plane_index(plane));
989 }
990
991 if (crtc)
992 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("Link plane state %p to [CRTC:%d]\n",
993 plane_state, crtc->base.id);
994 else
995 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("Link plane state %p to [NOCRTC]\n",
996 plane_state);
997
998 return 0;
999}
1000EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_atomic_set_crtc_for_plane);
1001
1002/**
1003 * drm_atomic_set_fb_for_plane - set framebuffer for plane
1004 * @plane_state: atomic state object for the plane
1005 * @fb: fb to use for the plane
1006 *
1007 * Changing the assigned framebuffer for a plane requires us to grab a reference
1008 * to the new fb and drop the reference to the old fb, if there is one. This
1009 * function takes care of all these details besides updating the pointer in the
1010 * state object itself.
1011 */
1012void
1013drm_atomic_set_fb_for_plane(struct drm_plane_state *plane_state,
1014 struct drm_framebuffer *fb)
1015{
1016 if (plane_state->fb)
1017 drm_framebuffer_unreference(plane_state->fb);
1018 if (fb)
1019 drm_framebuffer_reference(fb);
1020 plane_state->fb = fb;
1021
1022 if (fb)
1023 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("Set [FB:%d] for plane state %p\n",
1024 fb->base.id, plane_state);
1025 else
1026 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("Set [NOFB] for plane state %p\n",
1027 plane_state);
1028}
1029EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_atomic_set_fb_for_plane);
1030
1031/**
1032 * drm_atomic_set_crtc_for_connector - set crtc for connector
1033 * @conn_state: atomic state object for the connector
1034 * @crtc: crtc to use for the connector
1035 *
1036 * Changing the assigned crtc for a connector requires us to grab the lock and
1037 * state for the new crtc, as needed. This function takes care of all these
1038 * details besides updating the pointer in the state object itself.
1039 *
1040 * Returns:
1041 * 0 on success or can fail with -EDEADLK or -ENOMEM. When the error is EDEADLK
1042 * then the w/w mutex code has detected a deadlock and the entire atomic
1043 * sequence must be restarted. All other errors are fatal.
1044 */
1045int
1046drm_atomic_set_crtc_for_connector(struct drm_connector_state *conn_state,
1047 struct drm_crtc *crtc)
1048{
1049 struct drm_crtc_state *crtc_state;
1050
1051 if (crtc) {
1052 crtc_state = drm_atomic_get_crtc_state(conn_state->state, crtc);
1053 if (IS_ERR(crtc_state))
1054 return PTR_ERR(crtc_state);
1055 }
1056
1057 conn_state->crtc = crtc;
1058
1059 if (crtc)
1060 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("Link connector state %p to [CRTC:%d]\n",
1061 conn_state, crtc->base.id);
1062 else
1063 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("Link connector state %p to [NOCRTC]\n",
1064 conn_state);
1065
1066 return 0;
1067}
1068EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_atomic_set_crtc_for_connector);
1069
1070/**
1071 * drm_atomic_add_affected_connectors - add connectors for crtc
1072 * @state: atomic state
1073 * @crtc: DRM crtc
1074 *
1075 * This function walks the current configuration and adds all connectors
1076 * currently using @crtc to the atomic configuration @state. Note that this
1077 * function must acquire the connection mutex. This can potentially cause
1078 * unneeded seralization if the update is just for the planes on one crtc. Hence
1079 * drivers and helpers should only call this when really needed (e.g. when a
1080 * full modeset needs to happen due to some change).
1081 *
1082 * Returns:
1083 * 0 on success or can fail with -EDEADLK or -ENOMEM. When the error is EDEADLK
1084 * then the w/w mutex code has detected a deadlock and the entire atomic
1085 * sequence must be restarted. All other errors are fatal.
1086 */
1087int
1088drm_atomic_add_affected_connectors(struct drm_atomic_state *state,
1089 struct drm_crtc *crtc)
1090{
1091 struct drm_mode_config *config = &state->dev->mode_config;
1092 struct drm_connector *connector;
1093 struct drm_connector_state *conn_state;
1094 int ret;
1095
1096 ret = drm_modeset_lock(&config->connection_mutex, state->acquire_ctx);
1097 if (ret)
1098 return ret;
1099
1100 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("Adding all current connectors for [CRTC:%d] to %p\n",
1101 crtc->base.id, state);
1102
1103 /*
1104 * Changed connectors are already in @state, so only need to look at the
1105 * current configuration.
1106 */
1107 drm_for_each_connector(connector, state->dev) {
1108 if (connector->state->crtc != crtc)
1109 continue;
1110
1111 conn_state = drm_atomic_get_connector_state(state, connector);
1112 if (IS_ERR(conn_state))
1113 return PTR_ERR(conn_state);
1114 }
1115
1116 return 0;
1117}
1118EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_atomic_add_affected_connectors);
1119
1120/**
1121 * drm_atomic_add_affected_planes - add planes for crtc
1122 * @state: atomic state
1123 * @crtc: DRM crtc
1124 *
1125 * This function walks the current configuration and adds all planes
1126 * currently used by @crtc to the atomic configuration @state. This is useful
1127 * when an atomic commit also needs to check all currently enabled plane on
1128 * @crtc, e.g. when changing the mode. It's also useful when re-enabling a CRTC
1129 * to avoid special code to force-enable all planes.
1130 *
1131 * Since acquiring a plane state will always also acquire the w/w mutex of the
1132 * current CRTC for that plane (if there is any) adding all the plane states for
1133 * a CRTC will not reduce parallism of atomic updates.
1134 *
1135 * Returns:
1136 * 0 on success or can fail with -EDEADLK or -ENOMEM. When the error is EDEADLK
1137 * then the w/w mutex code has detected a deadlock and the entire atomic
1138 * sequence must be restarted. All other errors are fatal.
1139 */
1140int
1141drm_atomic_add_affected_planes(struct drm_atomic_state *state,
1142 struct drm_crtc *crtc)
1143{
1144 struct drm_plane *plane;
1145
1146 WARN_ON(!drm_atomic_get_existing_crtc_state(state, crtc));
1147
1148 drm_for_each_plane_mask(plane, state->dev, crtc->state->plane_mask) {
1149 struct drm_plane_state *plane_state =
1150 drm_atomic_get_plane_state(state, plane);
1151
1152 if (IS_ERR(plane_state))
1153 return PTR_ERR(plane_state);
1154 }
1155 return 0;
1156}
1157EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_atomic_add_affected_planes);
1158
1159/**
1160 * drm_atomic_connectors_for_crtc - count number of connected outputs
1161 * @state: atomic state
1162 * @crtc: DRM crtc
1163 *
1164 * This function counts all connectors which will be connected to @crtc
1165 * according to @state. Useful to recompute the enable state for @crtc.
1166 */
1167int
1168drm_atomic_connectors_for_crtc(struct drm_atomic_state *state,
1169 struct drm_crtc *crtc)
1170{
1171 struct drm_connector *connector;
1172 struct drm_connector_state *conn_state;
1173
1174 int i, num_connected_connectors = 0;
1175
1176 for_each_connector_in_state(state, connector, conn_state, i) {
1177 if (conn_state->crtc == crtc)
1178 num_connected_connectors++;
1179 }
1180
1181 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("State %p has %i connectors for [CRTC:%d]\n",
1182 state, num_connected_connectors, crtc->base.id);
1183
1184 return num_connected_connectors;
1185}
1186EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_atomic_connectors_for_crtc);
1187
1188/**
1189 * drm_atomic_legacy_backoff - locking backoff for legacy ioctls
1190 * @state: atomic state
1191 *
1192 * This function should be used by legacy entry points which don't understand
1193 * -EDEADLK semantics. For simplicity this one will grab all modeset locks after
1194 * the slowpath completed.
1195 */
1196void drm_atomic_legacy_backoff(struct drm_atomic_state *state)
1197{
1198 int ret;
1199
1200retry:
1201 drm_modeset_backoff(state->acquire_ctx);
1202
1203 ret = drm_modeset_lock(&state->dev->mode_config.connection_mutex,
1204 state->acquire_ctx);
1205 if (ret)
1206 goto retry;
1207 ret = drm_modeset_lock_all_crtcs(state->dev,
1208 state->acquire_ctx);
1209 if (ret)
1210 goto retry;
1211}
1212EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_atomic_legacy_backoff);
1213
1214/**
1215 * drm_atomic_check_only - check whether a given config would work
1216 * @state: atomic configuration to check
1217 *
1218 * Note that this function can return -EDEADLK if the driver needed to acquire
1219 * more locks but encountered a deadlock. The caller must then do the usual w/w
1220 * backoff dance and restart. All other errors are fatal.
1221 *
1222 * Returns:
1223 * 0 on success, negative error code on failure.
1224 */
1225int drm_atomic_check_only(struct drm_atomic_state *state)
1226{
1227 struct drm_device *dev = state->dev;
1228 struct drm_mode_config *config = &dev->mode_config;
1229 struct drm_plane *plane;
1230 struct drm_plane_state *plane_state;
1231 struct drm_crtc *crtc;
1232 struct drm_crtc_state *crtc_state;
1233 int i, ret = 0;
1234
1235 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("checking %p\n", state);
1236
1237 for_each_plane_in_state(state, plane, plane_state, i) {
1238 ret = drm_atomic_plane_check(plane, plane_state);
1239 if (ret) {
1240 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("[PLANE:%d] atomic core check failed\n",
1241 plane->base.id);
1242 return ret;
1243 }
1244 }
1245
1246 for_each_crtc_in_state(state, crtc, crtc_state, i) {
1247 ret = drm_atomic_crtc_check(crtc, crtc_state);
1248 if (ret) {
1249 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("[CRTC:%d] atomic core check failed\n",
1250 crtc->base.id);
1251 return ret;
1252 }
1253 }
1254
1255 if (config->funcs->atomic_check)
1256 ret = config->funcs->atomic_check(state->dev, state);
1257
1258 if (ret)
1259 return ret;
1260
1261 if (!state->allow_modeset) {
1262 for_each_crtc_in_state(state, crtc, crtc_state, i) {
1263 if (drm_atomic_crtc_needs_modeset(crtc_state)) {
1264 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("[CRTC:%d] requires full modeset\n",
1265 crtc->base.id);
1266 return -EINVAL;
1267 }
1268 }
1269 }
1270
1271 return 0;
1272}
1273EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_atomic_check_only);
1274
1275/**
1276 * drm_atomic_commit - commit configuration atomically
1277 * @state: atomic configuration to check
1278 *
1279 * Note that this function can return -EDEADLK if the driver needed to acquire
1280 * more locks but encountered a deadlock. The caller must then do the usual w/w
1281 * backoff dance and restart. All other errors are fatal.
1282 *
1283 * Also note that on successful execution ownership of @state is transferred
1284 * from the caller of this function to the function itself. The caller must not
1285 * free or in any other way access @state. If the function fails then the caller
1286 * must clean up @state itself.
1287 *
1288 * Returns:
1289 * 0 on success, negative error code on failure.
1290 */
1291int drm_atomic_commit(struct drm_atomic_state *state)
1292{
1293 struct drm_mode_config *config = &state->dev->mode_config;
1294 int ret;
1295
1296 ret = drm_atomic_check_only(state);
1297 if (ret)
1298 return ret;
1299
1300 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("commiting %p\n", state);
1301
1302 return config->funcs->atomic_commit(state->dev, state, false);
1303}
1304EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_atomic_commit);
1305
1306/**
1307 * drm_atomic_async_commit - atomic&async configuration commit
1308 * @state: atomic configuration to check
1309 *
1310 * Note that this function can return -EDEADLK if the driver needed to acquire
1311 * more locks but encountered a deadlock. The caller must then do the usual w/w
1312 * backoff dance and restart. All other errors are fatal.
1313 *
1314 * Also note that on successful execution ownership of @state is transferred
1315 * from the caller of this function to the function itself. The caller must not
1316 * free or in any other way access @state. If the function fails then the caller
1317 * must clean up @state itself.
1318 *
1319 * Returns:
1320 * 0 on success, negative error code on failure.
1321 */
1322int drm_atomic_async_commit(struct drm_atomic_state *state)
1323{
1324 struct drm_mode_config *config = &state->dev->mode_config;
1325 int ret;
1326
1327 ret = drm_atomic_check_only(state);
1328 if (ret)
1329 return ret;
1330
1331 DRM_DEBUG_ATOMIC("commiting %p asynchronously\n", state);
1332
1333 return config->funcs->atomic_commit(state->dev, state, true);
1334}
1335EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_atomic_async_commit);
1336
1337/*
1338 * The big monstor ioctl
1339 */
1340
1341static struct drm_pending_vblank_event *create_vblank_event(
1342 struct drm_device *dev, struct drm_file *file_priv, uint64_t user_data)
1343{
1344 struct drm_pending_vblank_event *e = NULL;
1345 unsigned long flags;
1346
1347 spin_lock_irqsave(&dev->event_lock, flags);
1348 if (file_priv->event_space < sizeof e->event) {
1349 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&dev->event_lock, flags);
1350 goto out;
1351 }
1352 file_priv->event_space -= sizeof e->event;
1353 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&dev->event_lock, flags);
1354
1355 e = kzalloc(sizeof *e, GFP_KERNEL);
1356 if (e == NULL) {
1357 spin_lock_irqsave(&dev->event_lock, flags);
1358 file_priv->event_space += sizeof e->event;
1359 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&dev->event_lock, flags);
1360 goto out;
1361 }
1362
1363 e->event.base.type = DRM_EVENT_FLIP_COMPLETE;
1364 e->event.base.length = sizeof e->event;
1365 e->event.user_data = user_data;
1366 e->base.event = &e->event.base;
1367 e->base.file_priv = file_priv;
1368 e->base.destroy = (void (*) (struct drm_pending_event *)) kfree;
1369
1370out:
1371 return e;
1372}
1373
1374static void destroy_vblank_event(struct drm_device *dev,
1375 struct drm_file *file_priv, struct drm_pending_vblank_event *e)
1376{
1377 unsigned long flags;
1378
1379 spin_lock_irqsave(&dev->event_lock, flags);
1380 file_priv->event_space += sizeof e->event;
1381 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&dev->event_lock, flags);
1382 kfree(e);
1383}
1384
1385static int atomic_set_prop(struct drm_atomic_state *state,
1386 struct drm_mode_object *obj, struct drm_property *prop,
1387 uint64_t prop_value)
1388{
1389 struct drm_mode_object *ref;
1390 int ret;
1391
1392 if (!drm_property_change_valid_get(prop, prop_value, &ref))
1393 return -EINVAL;
1394
1395 switch (obj->type) {
1396 case DRM_MODE_OBJECT_CONNECTOR: {
1397 struct drm_connector *connector = obj_to_connector(obj);
1398 struct drm_connector_state *connector_state;
1399
1400 connector_state = drm_atomic_get_connector_state(state, connector);
1401 if (IS_ERR(connector_state)) {
1402 ret = PTR_ERR(connector_state);
1403 break;
1404 }
1405
1406 ret = drm_atomic_connector_set_property(connector,
1407 connector_state, prop, prop_value);
1408 break;
1409 }
1410 case DRM_MODE_OBJECT_CRTC: {
1411 struct drm_crtc *crtc = obj_to_crtc(obj);
1412 struct drm_crtc_state *crtc_state;
1413
1414 crtc_state = drm_atomic_get_crtc_state(state, crtc);
1415 if (IS_ERR(crtc_state)) {
1416 ret = PTR_ERR(crtc_state);
1417 break;
1418 }
1419
1420 ret = drm_atomic_crtc_set_property(crtc,
1421 crtc_state, prop, prop_value);
1422 break;
1423 }
1424 case DRM_MODE_OBJECT_PLANE: {
1425 struct drm_plane *plane = obj_to_plane(obj);
1426 struct drm_plane_state *plane_state;
1427
1428 plane_state = drm_atomic_get_plane_state(state, plane);
1429 if (IS_ERR(plane_state)) {
1430 ret = PTR_ERR(plane_state);
1431 break;
1432 }
1433
1434 ret = drm_atomic_plane_set_property(plane,
1435 plane_state, prop, prop_value);
1436 break;
1437 }
1438 default:
1439 ret = -EINVAL;
1440 break;
1441 }
1442
1443 drm_property_change_valid_put(prop, ref);
1444 return ret;
1445}
1446
1447/**
1448 * drm_atomic_update_old_fb -- Unset old_fb pointers and set plane->fb pointers.
1449 *
1450 * @dev: drm device to check.
1451 * @plane_mask: plane mask for planes that were updated.
1452 * @ret: return value, can be -EDEADLK for a retry.
1453 *
1454 * Before doing an update plane->old_fb is set to plane->fb,
1455 * but before dropping the locks old_fb needs to be set to NULL
1456 * and plane->fb updated. This is a common operation for each
1457 * atomic update, so this call is split off as a helper.
1458 */
1459void drm_atomic_clean_old_fb(struct drm_device *dev,
1460 unsigned plane_mask,
1461 int ret)
1462{
1463 struct drm_plane *plane;
1464
1465 /* if succeeded, fixup legacy plane crtc/fb ptrs before dropping
1466 * locks (ie. while it is still safe to deref plane->state). We
1467 * need to do this here because the driver entry points cannot
1468 * distinguish between legacy and atomic ioctls.
1469 */
1470 drm_for_each_plane_mask(plane, dev, plane_mask) {
1471 if (ret == 0) {
1472 struct drm_framebuffer *new_fb = plane->state->fb;
1473 if (new_fb)
1474 drm_framebuffer_reference(new_fb);
1475 plane->fb = new_fb;
1476 plane->crtc = plane->state->crtc;
1477
1478 if (plane->old_fb)
1479 drm_framebuffer_unreference(plane->old_fb);
1480 }
1481 plane->old_fb = NULL;
1482 }
1483}
1484EXPORT_SYMBOL(drm_atomic_clean_old_fb);
1485
1486int drm_mode_atomic_ioctl(struct drm_device *dev,
1487 void *data, struct drm_file *file_priv)
1488{
1489 struct drm_mode_atomic *arg = data;
1490 uint32_t __user *objs_ptr = (uint32_t __user *)(unsigned long)(arg->objs_ptr);
1491 uint32_t __user *count_props_ptr = (uint32_t __user *)(unsigned long)(arg->count_props_ptr);
1492 uint32_t __user *props_ptr = (uint32_t __user *)(unsigned long)(arg->props_ptr);
1493 uint64_t __user *prop_values_ptr = (uint64_t __user *)(unsigned long)(arg->prop_values_ptr);
1494 unsigned int copied_objs, copied_props;
1495 struct drm_atomic_state *state;
1496 struct drm_modeset_acquire_ctx ctx;
1497 struct drm_plane *plane;
1498 struct drm_crtc *crtc __unused;
1499 struct drm_crtc_state *crtc_state;
1500 unsigned plane_mask;
1501 int ret = 0;
1502 unsigned int i, j;
1503
1504 /* disallow for drivers not supporting atomic: */
1505 if (!drm_core_check_feature(dev, DRIVER_ATOMIC))
1506 return -EINVAL;
1507
1508 /* disallow for userspace that has not enabled atomic cap (even
1509 * though this may be a bit overkill, since legacy userspace
1510 * wouldn't know how to call this ioctl)
1511 */
1512 if (!file_priv->atomic)
1513 return -EINVAL;
1514
1515 if (arg->flags & ~DRM_MODE_ATOMIC_FLAGS)
1516 return -EINVAL;
1517
1518 if (arg->reserved)
1519 return -EINVAL;
1520
1521 if ((arg->flags & DRM_MODE_PAGE_FLIP_ASYNC) &&
1522 !dev->mode_config.async_page_flip)
1523 return -EINVAL;
1524
1525 /* can't test and expect an event at the same time. */
1526 if ((arg->flags & DRM_MODE_ATOMIC_TEST_ONLY) &&
1527 (arg->flags & DRM_MODE_PAGE_FLIP_EVENT))
1528 return -EINVAL;
1529
1530 drm_modeset_acquire_init(&ctx, 0);
1531
1532 state = drm_atomic_state_alloc(dev);
1533 if (!state)
1534 return -ENOMEM;
1535
1536 state->acquire_ctx = &ctx;
1537 state->allow_modeset = !!(arg->flags & DRM_MODE_ATOMIC_ALLOW_MODESET);
1538
1539retry:
1540 plane_mask = 0;
1541 copied_objs = 0;
1542 copied_props = 0;
1543
1544 for (i = 0; i < arg->count_objs; i++) {
1545 uint32_t obj_id, count_props;
1546 struct drm_mode_object *obj;
1547
1548 if (get_user(obj_id, objs_ptr + copied_objs)) {
1549 ret = -EFAULT;
1550 goto out;
1551 }
1552
1553 obj = drm_mode_object_find(dev, obj_id, DRM_MODE_OBJECT_ANY);
1554 if (!obj || !obj->properties) {
1555 ret = -ENOENT;
1556 goto out;
1557 }
1558
1559 if (get_user(count_props, count_props_ptr + copied_objs)) {
1560 ret = -EFAULT;
1561 goto out;
1562 }
1563
1564 copied_objs++;
1565
1566 for (j = 0; j < count_props; j++) {
1567 uint32_t prop_id;
1568 uint64_t prop_value;
1569 struct drm_property *prop;
1570
1571 if (get_user(prop_id, props_ptr + copied_props)) {
1572 ret = -EFAULT;
1573 goto out;
1574 }
1575
1576 prop = drm_property_find(dev, prop_id);
1577 if (!prop) {
1578 ret = -ENOENT;
1579 goto out;
1580 }
1581
1582 if (copy_from_user(&prop_value,
1583 prop_values_ptr + copied_props,
1584 sizeof(prop_value))) {
1585 ret = -EFAULT;
1586 goto out;
1587 }
1588
1589 ret = atomic_set_prop(state, obj, prop, prop_value);
1590 if (ret)
1591 goto out;
1592
1593 copied_props++;
1594 }
1595
1596 if (obj->type == DRM_MODE_OBJECT_PLANE && count_props &&
1597 !(arg->flags & DRM_MODE_ATOMIC_TEST_ONLY)) {
1598 plane = obj_to_plane(obj);
1599 plane_mask |= (1 << drm_plane_index(plane));
1600 plane->old_fb = plane->fb;
1601 }
1602 }
1603
1604 if (arg->flags & DRM_MODE_PAGE_FLIP_EVENT) {
1605 for_each_crtc_in_state(state, crtc, crtc_state, i) {
1606 struct drm_pending_vblank_event *e;
1607
1608 e = create_vblank_event(dev, file_priv, arg->user_data);
1609 if (!e) {
1610 ret = -ENOMEM;
1611 goto out;
1612 }
1613
1614 crtc_state->event = e;
1615 }
1616 }
1617
1618 if (arg->flags & DRM_MODE_ATOMIC_TEST_ONLY) {
1619 /*
1620 * Unlike commit, check_only does not clean up state.
1621 * Below we call drm_atomic_state_free for it.
1622 */
1623 ret = drm_atomic_check_only(state);
1624 } else if (arg->flags & DRM_MODE_ATOMIC_NONBLOCK) {
1625 ret = drm_atomic_async_commit(state);
1626 } else {
1627 ret = drm_atomic_commit(state);
1628 }
1629
1630out:
1631 drm_atomic_clean_old_fb(dev, plane_mask, ret);
1632
1633 if (ret && arg->flags & DRM_MODE_PAGE_FLIP_EVENT) {
1634 /*
1635 * TEST_ONLY and PAGE_FLIP_EVENT are mutually exclusive,
1636 * if they weren't, this code should be called on success
1637 * for TEST_ONLY too.
1638 */
1639
1640 for_each_crtc_in_state(state, crtc, crtc_state, i) {
1641 if (!crtc_state->event)
1642 continue;
1643
1644 destroy_vblank_event(dev, file_priv,
1645 crtc_state->event);
1646 }
1647 }
1648
1649 if (ret == -EDEADLK) {
1650 drm_atomic_state_clear(state);
1651 drm_modeset_backoff(&ctx);
1652 goto retry;
1653 }
1654
1655 if (ret || arg->flags & DRM_MODE_ATOMIC_TEST_ONLY)
1656 drm_atomic_state_free(state);
1657
1658 drm_modeset_drop_locks(&ctx);
1659 drm_modeset_acquire_fini(&ctx);
1660
1661 return ret;
1662}
